findings.title: Unprotected approve Function
findings.description: The approve function is declared as public and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected Transfer Functionality
findings.description: The smart contract allows non-whitelisted wallets to transfer a specified number of tokens and hold a specified number of tokens, which can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Unprotected Permit Function
findings.description: The permit function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Burn Fee Percent
findings.description: The setBurnFeePercent function allows the owner to set a burn fee percentage, which can lead to unintended consequences if not properly managed.

findings.title: Swap Function Vulnerability
findings.description: The swap function has potential vulnerabilities due to fee-on-transfer tokens.
findings.function: swapExactTokensForTokens, swapTokensForExactTokens, swapExactETHForTokens, swapTokensForExactETH, swapExactTokensForETH, swapETHForExactTokens

findings.title: Reentrancy Vulnerability in sync Function
findings.description: The sync function is marked as external and has a reentrancy risk due to the 🛑 symbol.

findings.title: Unprotected Initialize Function
findings.description: The initialize function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized calls.

findings.title: Unprotected swapTokensForEth Function
findings.description: The private function swapTokensForEth lacks access control and can be exploited by unauthorized users.

findings.title: swapTokensForMarketingToken
findings.description: Potential vulnerability in private function swapTokensForMarketingToken allowing unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: transferToken
findings.description: A non-whitelisted wallet can only transfer a specified number of tokens.
